The number of COVID: 19 deaths per capita for the duration of the outbreak was used as a measure to verify the claim.
Multiple databases: including Worldometer and Johns Hopkins University, were checked to compare the death rates of Florida, New Jersey, and New York, confirming that Florida had a lower death rate.
News reports highlighted Florida: s record-breaking surge in COVID-19 cases, with the highest single-day total of new cases and the highest weekly death total during the outbreak.
Comparisons were made to other countries: 19, indicating that the United States, including Florida, had a higher death rate per 100,000 people compared to countries like the United Kingdom, Peru, and Chile.
